itemDescription: British-Irish author of historical fiction on religious themes

wikipedia_page.main: Deborah Alcock (1835– 15 January 1913) was a late-Victorian author of historical fiction focused on religious, evangelical themes.

response: * Deborah Alcock, British author of fiction

In January 1896, she helped to prevent a massacre of Armenian women and children in her care at Urfa,"Schoolmam Saves Lives" Oakland Tribune (June 9, 1910): 12. via Newspapers.com by standing in front of her church and school (some versions of the story have her holding an American flag in one hand) and challenging the Turkish forces to attack her personally. Six Turkish officials protected Shattuck from the "angry mob"."These Turks are Heroes" New York Times (February 24, 1896): 1. The incident was fictionalized in an 1899 novel, By Far Euphrates by Deborah Alcock."Our Book Table" Life and Light for Woman (April 1899): 177.
